sentence.text: Patient 11 was the child of a first cousin marriage.
He had facial asymmetry and downslanting palpebral fissures, but no midface or mandibular malformations (Fig. 1h).
Ears were prominent, low set and posteriorly rotated.
On the right hand, he had a thumb hypoplasia with thenar atrophy; the X-ray showed hypoplasia of the first metatarsal and phalanges (Fig. 2s, t).
In addition, there was a bilateral fifth finger clinodactyly.
On the left side, he had a mild equinovarus foot malformation (Fig. 3f).
He only had a single kidney on the left side.
